para: This is a variation of the and criteria for accepting or rejecting &skel; modifications. As with , &skel; modifications are accepted whether or not they lower the average effective energy, but, as with , the modifications must satisfy certain constraints. This criterion is best suited for putting finishing touches on the skeleton.

The homogeneity and shape_energy parameters are thresholds that each divide the &elems; into two classes: good (homogeneity above the threshold or shape energy below the threshold), and bad (homogeneity below the threshold or shape energy above the threshold). The rules for accepting a modification are that bad elements must not get worse and good elements may get worse, but may not cross the thresholds and become bad.
